So suki is actually

It's Japanese hot pot.

So basically Thai people

own version out of it.

Now in Thailand, you can
have three types of suki.

You can have suki as in a hot
pot, you can have suki nam,
which is a soup kind, what we're gonna do,
and then suki hang, which is a dry kind,
which I'll show you another time.

So the nam kind is basically
taking all of the ingredients

that would go into a hot
pot, just throw it in a soup,
